column3: The choice of words in that first sentence: “confrontée a une nouvelle arrivée de migrants” - in French it sounds like Spain is facing a new epidemic of an infectious disease. But no, he’s talking about migrants: men, women and children - human beings. https://t.co/yqdyDK9zHn

column2: Hate is an acquired disorder. It's infectious and atrophies the human nature of our existence with fear and despair. It is a disease, one we might fight, but the cure is knowledge, awareness, and the courage to lend our voice to those too afraid to use theirs.

It is caused by an infectious protein (prion) found in contaminated human brain tissue. Kuru is found among people from New Guinea who practiced a form of cannibalism in which they ate the brains of dead people as part of a funeral ritual.
